definition: to anxiously await
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread

sentences.english: The old woman was anxiously awaiting the return of her relatives.
sentences.chinese: 老婦人望眼欲穿地盼望親人歸來。

sentences.english: Crammed full of film companies desperate for good idea.
sentences.chinese: 那有的是電影公司在望眼欲穿等着好本子。

sentences.english: Did he not know that she hung on his letters?
sentences.chinese: 難道他不知道她一直是望眼欲穿地盼他的信嗎？

sentences.english: That do not know what it feels like, but if it wistfully.
sentences.chinese: 說不清楚是什麼感覺，但又好象望眼欲穿。

sentences.english: It was the happy reunion her family had been longing for.
sentences.chinese: 對望眼欲穿的家人來說，這真是個快樂的團圓。

definition: to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
to wish for the stars and the moon/to have unreal expectations
pinyin: pan4 xing1 xing1 pan4 yue4 liang4

worried/anxious
waiting anxiously/impatient

to hope for/to long for/to expect

to expect/to look forward to/anxious for sth/to hope (to get sth)
to hope for/to look forward to
ardent/eager/earnest
to be late/to arrive slowly/to be slow in the coming
hundred knots of worry in one's intestines (idiom); weighed down with anxiety
elated/overjoyed
